summary: This bill, the Selena Commemorative Coin Act, directs the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins in recognition of Selena Quintanilla. The bill specifies the denominations ($5 gold, $1 silver, and half-dollar clad coins), specifications (weight, diameter, metal content), and design requirements, including an image of Selena. Coins will be sold with surcharges, the proceeds of which will go to the Friends of the Corpus Christi Museum of Science and History. The bill also details issuance, sales, and financial assurances.
